cs.umass.edu.myactivitiestoolkit.steps

Class StepDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs.umass.edu.myactivitiestoolkit.steps.StepDetector

  • public class StepDetector
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for detecting steps from the accelerometer sensor. All step listeners that have been registered will be notified when a step is detected.

      StepDetector()

    • Method Detail

      • registerOnStepListener

        public void registerOnStepListener(OnStepListener stepListener)
        Registers a step listener for handling step events.
        Parameters:
        stepListener - defines how step events are handled.

      • unregisterOnStepListener

        public void unregisterOnStepListener(OnStepListener stepListener)
        Unregisters the specified step listener.
        Parameters:
        stepListener - the listener to be unregistered. It must already be registered.

      • unregisterOnStepListeners

        public void unregisterOnStepListeners()
        Unregisters all step listeners.

      • onSensorChanged

        public void onSensorChanged(SensorEvent event)
        Here is where you will receive accelerometer readings, buffer them if necessary and run your step detection algorithm. When a step is detected, call onStepDetected(long, float[]) to notify all listeners. Recall that human steps tend to take anywhere between 0.5 and 2 seconds.
        Parameters:
        event - sensor reading

      • onAccuracyChanged

        public void onAccuracyChanged(Sensor sensor,
                              int i)
